root.name: getFloatContent()

example.code: # The following short XML file called "positions.xml" is parsed # in the code below. It must be in the project's "data" folder. # # <?xml version="1.0"?> # <positions> # <position id="0">128.111</position> # <position id="1">256.222</position> # <position id="2">512.333</position> # </positions> def setup(): xml = loadXML("positions.xml") firstChild = xml.getChild("position") print(firstChild.getFloatContent()) # Sketch prints: # 128.11099243164062

root.description: Returns the content of an element as a float. If there is no such content, either null or the provided default value is returned.
